snippet: Larry Davis, owner of DCM Erectors Inc., is expected to be charged with evading requirements on hiring subcontractors, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
abstract: Larry Davis, owner of DCM Erectors Inc, company that has done nearly $1 billion in work on steel skeletons of two World Trade Center towers and transit hub, is expected to be implicated in criminal fraud case; charged with evading requirements on hiring subcontractors, Davis's case would be among largest to involve misuse of funds designated for minority- or women-owned businesses.
lead_paragraph: Larry Davis, owner of DCM Erectors Inc., is expected to be charged with evading requirements on hiring subcontractors, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

headline.main: World Trade Center Contractor Is Said to Be Focus of Inquiry Into Misuse of Funds
headline.print_headline: Trade Center Contractor Is Said to Be Focus of Inquiry Into Misuse of Funds

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
